summary: This document is a criminal history repository inquiry from the New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services for Tova Noel, showing she was placed on federal probation in November 2019 and listing her prior job applications with NYPD and corrections departments. It appears to be a background check document, possibly related to her involvement in the Epstein/Ghislaine Maxwell case.

keyFacts: Tova Noel was placed on federal probation by the US Pretrial Services Agency in Manhattan on November 19, 2019, with probation extending to November 19, 2025.
The document shows Tova Noel had multiple job applications with law enforcement and corrections agencies including NYPD, NYS Department of Corrections, and NYC administrative services.
The criminal history inquiry indicates no arrest or court history reported in New York State, but notes the subject is currently on federal probation.
The document is dated December 11, 2019, and appears to be a background check or repository inquiry conducted by the New York State Division of Criminal Justice Services.
Tova Noel's probation status in November 2019 coincides with the timeframe of Jeffrey Epstein's death in August 2019 and the subsequent investigations.
